title: Authors and Citation
text: Felix Luginbuhl. Author, maintainer. Hedwig Prey. Author. Fachstelle für Statistik Kanton St.Gallen. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Luginbuhl F, Prey H (2024). SpiGesXML: Extract data SpiGes XML files. R package version 0.0.6, https://swissstatsr.org/SpiGesXML/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SpiGesXML: Extract data from SpiGes XML files},   author = {Felix Luginbuhl and Hedwig Prey},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.6},   url = {https://swissstatsr.org/SpiGesXML/}, }

what: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
text: Extract data SpiGes XML files using R programming.

title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
code: # install from the r-universe install.packages("SpiGesXML", repos = "https://swissstatsr.r-universe.dev") # install from GitHub remotes::install_github("SwissStatsR/SpiGesXML")

title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
text: Using spiges_get_df(), can get data SpiGes XML file using x argument. x argument can URL path give XML file. reasons data given node, spiges_get_df() return error suggestions existing nodes SpiGes file. spiges_get_df() function validate internally XML file. correctly validated, returns data success message console. validation incorrect, error message returned. return data even incorrect validation, can add use force argument TRUE. example incorrect format “INCORRECT VALUE” “burnr”: use incorrect XML file, spiges_get_df() return error message (function can return data anyway using force = TRUE): Variables can individually selected using variables argument: variable name variables doesn’t exist file, return error message. multiple variable names provided, correct variable names returned (error messages variable name correct).
code: library(SpiGesXML)  # SpiGes XML file example  # https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/gesundheit/gesundheitswesen/projekt-spiges.assetdetail.27905035.html xml_example <- "https://dam-api.bfs.admin.ch/hub/api/dam/assets/32129227/master"  spiges_get_df(x = xml_example, node = "Administratives") ## ✔ Format correctly validated using spiges-data v.1.4.  ## # A tibble: 13 × 34 ##    ent_id    burnr fall_id burnr…¹ abc_f…² gesch…³ alter alter…⁴ wohno…⁵ wohnk…⁶ ##    <chr>     <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ##  1 100000012 1000… 1       712978… A       2       97    <NA>    GE03    GE      ##  2 100000012 1000… 2       712879… A       1       49    <NA>    AG52    AG      ##  3 100000012 1000… 3       712934… A       2       101   <NA>    BE76    BE      ##  4 100000012 1000… 4       712879… A       1       62    <NA>    AG52    AG      ##  5 100000012 1000… 5       712879… A       2       61    <NA>    AG52    AG      ##  6 100000012 1000… 6       712978… A       2       84    <NA>    VD39    VD      ##  7 100000012 1000… 7       712879… A       1       75    <NA>    BE48    BE      ##  8 100000012 1000… 8       711791… A       2       91    <NA>    BE52    BE      ##  9 100000012 1000… 9       712879… A       1       65    <NA>    BE48    BE      ## 10 100000012 1000… 10      712934… A       2       105   <NA>    ZH29    ZH      ## 11 100000012 1000… 11      711791… A       1       67    <NA>    ZH23    ZH      ## 12 100000012 1000… 12      712934… A       1       55    <NA>    BS09    BS      ## 13 100000012 1000… 13      712879… A       2       67    <NA>    TI30    TI      ## # … with 24 more variables: wohnland <chr>, nationalitaet <chr>, ## #   eintrittsdatum <chr>, eintritt_aufenthalt <chr>, eintrittsart <chr>, ## #   einw_instanz <chr>, liegeklasse <chr>, versicherungsklasse <chr>, ## #   admin_urlaub <chr>, chlz <chr>, aufenthalt_ips <chr>, beatmung <chr>, ## #   schwere_score <chr>, art_score <chr>, nems <chr>, aufenthalt_imc <chr>, ## #   aufwand_imc <chr>, hauptleistungsstelle <chr>, grundversicherung <chr>, ## #   tarif <chr>, austrittsdatum <chr>, austrittsentscheid <chr>, … spiges_get_df(x = xml_example, node = "Admin") Error in `spiges_get_df()`: ! `node` must be one of "Administratives", "Diagnose", "KostentraegerFall", "Behandlung", or "Rechnung", not "Admin". ℹ Did you mean "Administratives"? xml_file_incorrect <- system.file(   "example_incorrect_format.xml",    package = "SpiGesXML" )  library(xml2) # install.packages("xml2")  # for example burnr="INCORRECT VALUE" xml2::read_xml(xml_file_incorrect) ## {xml_document} ## <Unternehmen ent_id="100000012" version="1.4" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://www.bfs.admin.ch/xmlns/gvs/spiges-data/1.4"> ## [1] <Standort burnr="INCORRECT VALUE">\n  <Fall fall_id="1">\n    <Administra ... spiges_get_df(   x = xml_file_incorrect,   node = "Administratives",   force = FALSE # TO RETURN DATA, USE "TRUE" ) ## ✖ Incorrect format  using spiges-data v.1.4. ##  ## Element '{http://www.bfs.admin.ch/xmlns/gvs/spiges-data/1.4}Standort', attribute 'burnr': 'INCORRECT VALUE' is not a valid value of the local atomic type. spiges_get_df(x = xml_example, node = "Administratives", variables = c("abc_fall", "geschlecht")) ## ✔ Format correctly validated using spiges-data v.1.4.  ## # A tibble: 13 × 5 ##    ent_id    burnr    fall_id abc_fall geschlecht ##    <chr>     <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>      ##  1 100000012 10000012 1       A        2          ##  2 100000012 10000012 2       A        1          ##  3 100000012 10000012 3       A        2          ##  4 100000012 10000012 4       A        1          ##  5 100000012 10000012 5       A        2          ##  6 100000012 10000012 6       A        2          ##  7 100000012 10000012 7       A        1          ##  8 100000012 10000012 8       A        2          ##  9 100000012 10000012 9       A        1          ## 10 100000012 10000012 10      A        2          ## 11 100000012 10000012 11      A        1          ## 12 100000012 10000012 12      A        1          ## 13 100000012 10000012 13      A        2 spiges_get_df(x = xml_example, node = "Administratives", variables = "Geschlecht") Error in `spiges_get_df()`: ! `variables` must be one of "burnr_gesv", "abc_fall", "geschlecht", "alter", "alter_U1", "wohnort_medstat", "wohnkanton",   "wohnland", "nationalitaet", "eintrittsdatum", "eintritt_aufenthalt", "eintrittsart", "einw_instanz", "liegeklasse",   "versicherungsklasse", "admin_urlaub", "chlz", "aufenthalt_ips", "beatmung", "schwere_score", "art_score", "nems", "aufenthalt_imc",   "aufwand_imc", "hauptleistungsstelle", "grundversicherung", "tarif", "austrittsdatum", "austrittsentscheid", "austritt_aufenthalt", or   "austritt_behandlung", not "Geschlecht". ℹ Did you mean "geschlecht"?

title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
text: can also access “Personenidentifikatoren” data using spiges_get_df(). hood function using spiges-ids format validation (available nodes using spiges-data validation format).
code: id_example <- "https://dam-api.bfs.admin.ch/hub/api/dam/assets/32129180/master"  spiges_get_df(x = id_example, node = "Personenidentifikatoren") ## ✔ Format correctly validated using spiges-ids v.1.4.  ## # A tibble: 2 × 5 ##   ent_id    burnr    fall_id ahv           geburtsdatum ##   <chr>     <chr>    <chr>   <chr>         <chr>        ## 1 845724581 71548624 5443546 7561234567897 20220412     ## 2 845724581 71548624 5443547 7561111111119 19850117

title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
text: can change version XSD schema validation using schema_xsd argument (default “latest”). Note might encounter issues custom schema validation SpigGesXML aims work latest schema version available. example schema version “1.3”: another example version 1.3 “Personenidentifikatoren” node:
code: # SpiGes format version 1.3  spiges_get_df(   x = "https://dam-api.bfs.admin.ch/hub/api/dam/assets/27905035/master",    node = "Diagnose",   schema_xsd = "https://dam-api.bfs.admin.ch/hub/api/dam/assets/27905037/master" ) ## ✔ Format correctly validated using spiges-data v.1.3.  ## # A tibble: 2 × 8 ##   ent_id    burnr    fall_id diagnose_id diagnose_kode diagnos…¹ diagn…² diagn…³ ##   <chr>     <chr>    <chr>   <chr>       <chr>         <chr>     <chr>   <chr>   ## 1 845724581 71548624 5443546 1           Z380          <NA>      <NA>    <NA>    ## 2 845724581 71548624 5443547 1           F29           <NA>      1       <NA>    ## # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​diagnose_seitigkeit, ²​diagnose_poa, ## #   ³​diagnose_zusatz spiges_get_df(     x = "https://dam-api.bfs.admin.ch/hub/api/dam/assets/27905038/master",      node = "Personenidentifikatoren",     schema_xsd = "https://dam-api.bfs.admin.ch/hub/api/dam/assets/27905036/master" ) ## ✔ Format correctly validated using spiges-ids v.1.3.  ## # A tibble: 2 × 5 ##   ent_id    burnr    fall_id ahv           geburtsdatum ##   <chr>     <chr>    <chr>   <chr>         <chr>        ## 1 845724581 71548624 5443546 7561234567897 20220412     ## 2 845724581 71548624 5443547 7561111111119 19850117

title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
text: Show node names available data extraction XML SpiGes:

title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
text: Get list variable names available SpiGes node names SpiGes Schema XSD file:
code: spiges_get_name_variables(   schema_xsd = "https://dam-api.bfs.admin.ch/hub/api/dam/assets/32129184/master" ) |>   str() ## List of 4 ##  $ Unternehmen            : chr [1:2] "ent_id" "version" ##  $ Standort               : chr "burnr" ##  $ Fall                   : chr "fall_id" ##  $ Personenidentifikatoren: chr [1:2] "ahv" "geburtsdatum"

title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
text: following node names available data extraction: “Unternehmen”, “Standort”, “Fall” “Kantonsdaten”.

title: Extract data from SpiGes XML files
text: specified attributes canton can set variables… problematic including function.

what: Get SpiGes node as dataframe — spiges_get_df
title: Get SpiGes node as dataframe — spiges_get_df
text: Return tibble/dataframe SpiGes node name. default, variables returned. Variables can selected using `variables` argument.

title: Get SpiGes node as dataframe — spiges_get_df
code: spiges_get_df(x, node, variables = NULL, schema_xsd = "latest", force = FALSE)

title: Get SpiGes node as dataframe — spiges_get_df
text: x string, connection, raw vector. See xml2::read_xml node Name node string, see get_node_names variables Name variables, default returns variables schema_xsd URL XSD schema version, default "latest" version. force default FALSE. TRUE, returns data even validation error.

title: Get SpiGes node as dataframe — spiges_get_df
text: data.frame/tibble

what: Get node names available for data extraction of a SpiGes XML — spiges_get_name_nodes
title: Get node names available for data extraction of a SpiGes XML — spiges_get_name_nodes
text: Return main children node names SpiGes XML. node names "Unternehmen", "Standort", "Fall", "Kantonsdaten" removed function spiges_get_df() provide support extract related data.
